alert.note: Alert for Addison; Caledonia; Chittenden; Essex; Franklin; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Rutland; Washington; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 29 at 10:24PM EDT until March 29 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Lamoille County in northwestern Vermont... Orange County in central Vermont... Caledonia County in northeastern Vermont... Orleans County in northeastern Vermont... Addison County in central Vermont... Northwestern Essex County in northeastern Vermont... Eastern Chittenden County in northwestern Vermont... Northern Rutland County in southern Vermont... Northern Windsor County in southern Vermont... Washington County in central Vermont... Eastern Franklin County in northwestern Vermont... * Until 1130 PM EDT. * At 1017 PM EDT, a broken line of intense snow showers and snow squall was located along a line extending from near Morses Line to South Burlington to near Bridport, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph or greater and perhaps a rumble of thunder. Wet roads will eventually become slush or snow covered in the higher terrain and as temperatures fall to freezing or below could begin to become icy. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous in the higher terrain and mountain valleys of central and eastern Vermont. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 1 and 83. Interstate 91 between mile markers 64 and 80, near mile marker 131, between mile markers 134 and 136, and between mile markers 138 and 177. State routes such as 2,15,100 and 108 to name a few. Locations impacted include... Barre, Rutland, Montpelier, Lyndon, Woodstock, Middlebury, Newport City, St. Johnsbury, Morrisville, Enosburg Falls, Orleans, Derby Center, Charleston, Braintree Hill, Killington, Glover, Waterbury Village, Montgomery Center, Websterville and Albany. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED

area.areaDesc: Addison; Caledonia; Chittenden; Essex; Franklin; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Rutland; Washington; Windsor
